block.p: Representative Asa Hutchinson (Op-Ed, June 22) feels that the current questioning of eyewitness testimony is ''a dangerous attack on the foundations of our judicial system'' by those opposed to the death penalty. Representative Asa Hutchinson (Op-Ed, June 22) feels that the current questioning of eyewitness testimony is ''a dangerous attack on the foundations of our judicial system'' by those opposed to the death penalty. Despite being particularly compelling to juries, eyewitness testimony deserves to be scrutinized because both scientific research and judicial experience find eyewitnesses to be notoriously unreliable.

More than 80 percent of the 60 false convictions overturned by New York's Innocence Project were a result of erroneous eyewitness testimony. Research also shows that the more convinced eyewitnesses are of the accuracy of their testimony, the less likely they are to be correct.
It is probable that false eyewitness testimony has already led to execution of the innocent. Let's strive to assure it doesn't happen in the future.
